meanings.sent1: The teacher's elucidation of the math problem helped me understand it better.
meanings.sent2: The book provided an elucidation of the complex scientific theory.
meanings.sent3: The magician's elucidation of his tricks left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent4: Her elucidation of the historical event brought new insights to light.
meanings.sent5: The detective's elucidation of the case was thorough and detailed.

meanings.definition: The act of making something clear
meanings.sent1: The elucidation of the instructions made it easier to follow.
meanings.sent2: His elucidation of the concept simplified the learning process.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's elucidation of the joke made everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The artist's elucidation of the painting technique was enlightening.
meanings.sent5: The coach's elucidation of the game plan boosted the team's confidence.

meanings.definition: The process of shedding light on a subject
meanings.sent1: The scientist's elucidation of the theory revealed new possibilities.
meanings.sent2: Through her elucidation, the mystery surrounding the case was solved.
meanings.sent3: The chef's elucidation of the recipe made cooking seem like a breeze.
meanings.sent4: The journalist's elucidation of the scandal exposed the truth.
meanings.sent5: The professor's elucidation of the topic sparked intellectual curiosity.
